transcript.text: what is a terminological question now I
first heard this term a couple years ago
when Noam Chomsky was asked in an
interview whether he thought Trump to be
a fascist he said that's a
terminological question suggesting that
it wasn't worth exploring but the first
place my mind went was terminal as in
the end of something as in once we're
asking questions like is a hot dog a
sandwich or is horseback riding a sport
or can a urinal be art or is Trump a
fascist the actual substance of the
conversation is over and you're debating
a meaningless question of course
terminological actually means that it's
a question of terminology or vocabulary
and not much more but the terminal end
thing works well too right language is
fun
